sn7.20:1.2: Then a mendicant brahmin approached the Blessed One
sn7.20:1.4: Master Gotama, I am a mendicant and you are a mendicant. What is the difference between us in this respect?
sn7.20:2.1: [The Blessed One: ]  “It is not thus that one becomes a mendicant,
sn7.20:2.2: Just because one begs others for alms.
sn7.20:2.3: If one has taken up a domestic practice,
sn7.20:2.4: One still has not become a bhikkhu.
sn7.20:3.2: and one leads the holy life,
sn7.20:3.3: Who fares in the world with comprehension:
sn7.20:3.4: He is truly called a bhikkhu.”
sn7.20:4.1: When this was said, the mendicant brahmin said to the Blessed One:
sn7.20:4.3: Let Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who from today has gone for refuge for life.
